item.title: Colossal
item.description:
Colossal

Commercial photographer Sam Kaplan 's latest project, transforms sticks of chewing gum into monumental structures, stacking the sticky treat in shapes that imitate architectural forms. Hundreds of pieces of gum criss cross and stand upwards to create pyramids, columns, and arches-held tightly together with support from super glue.

item.title: Projections in the Forest
item.description:
Projections in the Forest

Behind the scenes: http://vimeo.com/3hund/behindthescenes The projection mapping "bioluminescent forest" is made by artists Friedrich van Schoor and Tarek Mawad. The artists spent six weeks in the forest fascinated by the silence and natural occurrences in nature, especially the phenomenon "bioluminescence".

item.title: The Impossible Project's first instant camera has an app with full manual controls
item.description:
The Impossible Project's first instant camera has an app with full manual controls

The Impossible Project is best known for keeping Polaroid's type 600 instant film format alive even after it was abandoned by the long-time camera maker in 2008. The company also refurbishes old Polaroid type 600 cameras in order to resell them.

item.title: Top Bartenders Name Their Favorite Drinking Cities
item.description:
Top Bartenders Name Their Favorite Drinking Cities

These are the best drinking cities, according to some of America's best bartenders, including New York, New Orleans, Portland,…

item.title: Drink to Dublin: Jameson enlist artist James Earley to design new label.
item.description:
Drink to Dublin: Jameson enlist artist James Earley to design new label.

Any visitor to Dublin's fair city will quickly sense the iconic presence of Jameson whiskey, which is woven into the fabric of life in Ireland's capital. The brand began producing whiskey in Dublin in 1780, and has always been closely linked with the city's rich cultural scene, championing its music, literature, and art.

item.title: Bits And Pieces - An organic wave of Hoberman Spheres
item.description:
Bits And Pieces - An organic wave of Hoberman Spheres

Currently on show at Berlin's NOME Gallery is the latest work by Nils VÃ¶lker titled Bits And Pieces. The installation consists out of 108 mass-produced toy spheres hanging in the middle of the exhibition space, individually addressable and controlled, to create organic waves that appear to move throughout the space.

item.title: Moleskine's Comprehensive Smart Writing Set
item.description:
Moleskine's Comprehensive Smart Writing Set

At a conference on productivity-which touched on everything from the importance of tech-free alone time to the educational and emotional benefits of writing by hand (as outlined in a series of studies on the subject)- Moleskine unveiled their latest analog-to-digital wonder.

item.title: Precious cargo: the Container Artist Residency program sets sail.
item.description:
Precious cargo: the Container Artist Residency program sets sail.

Aboard commercial cargo ships is where the Container Artist Residency 01 program is finding its abode. Completely isolated from the rest of the world, the Residency allows its artists to work in a remote space with no tangible lines of communication to the outside world.
